item.title: Road is very icy, 4th January
item.description:
Gundulph Road hasn’t been gritted and is very icy. Yesterday, on 3rd January 2026, a car crashed into my stationary car and then fled the scene. The icy road clearly contributed to the accident. This is a busy cut-through and there have been many accidents on it. Given the statistics showing its propensity for accidents, it’s negligible that the council hasn’t gritted it. Please escalate this to your legal team and I’ll pursue this matter legally. I also need the road gritted as soon as possible. Additionally, there’s glass on the floor outside 48 that needs cleaning. This was caused by the collision. Please confirm you’ve received this complaint and provide me with details of my allocated point of contact.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gundulph Road, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding from burst pipe has frozen on hill, 4th January
item.description:
I believe the burst pipe may have been identified already as blue spray paint has been put down in the area, however due to the cold weather conditions the water is frozen on quite a steep public walkway and causing a major slipping hazard. There are several elderly people who live on this road and plenty of foot traffic making this quite dangerous. If some salt could please be put down that would be great. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadoak Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: People still dumping their rubbish at the side of the civic centre car park, 4th January
item.description:
This is an ongoing problem. People park and charge their environmentally friendly cars in the car park and whilst waiting for their cars to charge they clear all the rubbish out of them and throw them down the side of the building into Tweedy Way. Please can all of this rubbish be picked up again, extra bins be provided and some sort of mesh over the gaps to prevent people throwing their rubbish and garden waste onto this green area where the council have to continually clear it up. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Close, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
